basics.name: Quentin Goestchel
basics.label: Postdoctoral Researcher in Acoustics
basics.summary: Postdoctoral researcher specializing in acoustic propagation, bioacoustics, and distributed acoustic sensing for marine mammal detection. Expert in numerical modeling methods and time domain approaches for environmental acoustics applications.

work.name: University of Washington
work.summary: Postdoctoral scholarship at the School of Oceanography studying the capabilities of distributed acoustic sensing (DAS) to record low frequency baleen whale vocalizations.
highlights: Develop automated tools to detect and localize fin and blue whale calls with DAS
Contributing to the DAS4Whales open-source package

work.name: Strasbourg University
work.summary: Teaching computer science fundamentals and development techniques to university students.
highlights: Development techniques - Teaching to second year students
Basics of computer architecture - Teaching to first year students
Academic methodologies and techniques - Teaching to first year students

work.name: Joint Research Unit in Environmental Acoustics (UMRAE)
work.summary: Numerical modeling of acoustic propagation over a forest floor using the TLM approach.

work.name: Technical University of Eindhoven (TU/e)
work.summary: Research on applicability of the diffusion equation method for acoustic simulations on 3D urban models.
highlights: Development of a finite volume method Matlab code to model sound energy density diffusion in irregular tetrahedral meshes

work.name: CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research
work.summary: Modeling the noise impact of the LHC expansion (HL-LHC) with engineering software.

education.area: Acoustic propagation in forest environments. Time domain numerical methods toward bioacoustic applications.
courses: Theoretical study on the Transmission Line Matrix Method for modeling long-range forest scenarios
Updating, improving and maintaining a code architecture in Python and OpenCL (C99)
Collaboration with bioacousticians (MNHN) for in-situ data
Supervision of an intern from the computer science University Institute of Technology (IUT), Strasbourg (6 months internship)
Sound manipulation as diagnostic tool and information vector
Continuum mechanics, fluid mechanics, waves, vibrations
Preparation for Grandes Ecoles competitive entrance exams

awards.title: Early Career Presenter Award in Computational Acoustics
awards.summary: Award received at the 186th ASA meeting, Ottawa, Canada.

awards.title: University of Washington eScience postdoctoral fellowship

skills.name: Acoustics
keywords: Disturbance noise effect on quiet areas

interests.name: Research Interests
keywords: Disturbance noise effect on quiet areas
